titleStmt.title: Queries upon queries, or, Enquiries into Certain queries upon Dr. Pierce's sermon at Whitehall, Feb. 1
titleStmt.author: Dobson, John, 1633-1681.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A36190 of text R12019 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing D1755). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 36 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 9 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: Queries upon queries, or, Enquiries into Certain queries upon Dr. Pierce's sermon at Whitehall, Feb. 1
titleStmt.author: Dobson, John, 1633-1681.

notesStmt.note: A reply to Certain queries upon Dr. Pierces sermon at Whitehall Feb. 1.
This defense of Pierce was one item in a series by Dobson which finally resulted in his expulsion from Oxford on the grounds of libeling Henry Yerbury.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
